conclusion: Analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves backward.
The image shows multiple objects on a wooden floor, including a cake, a sandal/shoe, a domino piece, and a dark object, with shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
When the light source moves backward, shadows will move closer to directly beneath their respective objects due to the angle of light becoming more vertical.
The shadows will decrease in size as the light source moves farther away, resulting in less shadow divergence.
Shadows will become more defined and compact, approaching the actual size/shape of the objects.
Shadow A will move closer to being directly beneath the cake and become smaller and more defined, approaching the circular shape of the cake base.
Shadow B will move closer to being directly beneath the dark object and become smaller, matching more closely with the object's actual profile.
Shadow C will move closer to being directly beneath its object and become smaller and more defined.
Shadow D will move closer to being directly beneath its object and become smaller and more defined.
Final answer: All shadows will move closer to being directly beneath their respective objects and decrease in size, becoming smaller and more defined.
